title: 104_hr2278
content: The "Import Control and Safe Handling of Spent Nuclear Fuel Act of 1995" prohibits the import of spent nuclear fuel into the United States unless approved by Congress, licensed by the appropriate Federal agency, and operating repositories are in place. National security exceptions are also outlined. The "Import Control and Safe Handling of Spent Nuclear Fuel Act of 1995" prohibits the import of spent nuclear fuel into the United States unless approved by Congress, licensed by the appropriate Federal agency, and operating repositories are in place. The prohibition does not apply to imports from countries suspected of producing or developing nuclear weapons, with notification to Congress required in advance. Samples for testing and evaluation for national security purposes are also exempt from the prohibition. SEC. 4. GUIDELINES BY PORT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE SAFE SHIPMENT OF CERTAIN MATERIAL. Port authorities can establish guidelines for the safe handling of spent nuclear fuel at ports, including worker training and response plans for emergencies. Local communities must be informed of the handling of spent nuclear fuel at ports, including response plans for emergencies. Guidelines should also cover storage and transportation standards for spent nuclear fuel. Guidelines for the transportation of spent nuclear fuel should include standards for storage and parking, as well as prohibitions on movement during certain conditions to minimize radiation exposure and accident risks. Worker radiation exposure levels must not exceed public exposure standards. These guidelines are more protective of public health and safety than other requirements. Guidelines for transportation of spent nuclear fuel must be more protective of public health and safety than other requirements. Existing laws on fuel transportation do not prevent the adoption of stricter guidelines. SEC. 5. Liability and indemnification of the port in handling nuclear materials shall not be affected by this Act. SEC. 6. Definitions. The term "atomic energy defense activity" refers to various functions carried out by the Secretary of Energy, including naval reactors development, weapons activities, verification technology, nuclear materials production, waste management, security, and research. The term "port authority" refers to any local, regional, State, or interstate authority with jurisdiction over ports. The term "port authority" refers to any local, regional, State, or interstate authority with jurisdiction over ports in the United States. The terms "repository" and "spent nuclear fuel" are defined in the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982.
